Japan attempts to update armed forces
articles.content:
Japan attempts to update armed forces
   Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Japan's NHK reported on Tuesday that the defence agency decided to include in the budget for the fiscal year 2000 fund for the introduction of long-distance large transport planes and air-refueling tankers.   Such large-size and long-distance transport planes will be developed at home for emergency transport and "rapid participation in 'UN peace-keeping operations,'" the report said.   The defence agency also seeks to strengthen the system of long watch-out for the situation of the Korean peninsula by using refueling tankers.   The fact shows that the Japanese reactionaries are stepping up the updating of armed forces to unleash a war for reinvasion of Korea.

Rally of women workers from across S. Korea held in Seoul
articles.content:
Rally of women workers from across S. Korea held in Seoul
   Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A rally of women workers from across South Korea was reportedly held in Seoul on March 6, attended by about 1,000 women workers.    It was co-sponsored by the Women's Fellowship Society, the council of women workers, the "Korean Confederation of Trade Unions" and the "Federation of Korean Trade Unions" in South Korea.   They in a resolution demanded a halt to the "restructuring" and an act of giving only part-time jobs to women, measures for stable living and employment of women out of job.   They also called for a stop to the maltreatment of  workers, measures for protection of the part-time workers and guarantee of their rights, reduction of working hours and prompt social reforms.

"Mailing" to new university students repudiated
articles.content:
"Mailing" to new university students repudiated
    Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Pusan University Students of South Korea staged a demonstration on March 5 denouncing the "Minister of Education" for "mailing" a letter to new university students, a Seoul based radio said.   They charged that his sending a letter to new university students across South Korea recently urging them to stop student movement was a violation of freedom of thinking and called for an open apology and guarantee for right to student autonomy.

Cuban ambassador presents credentials to Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Cuban ambassador presents credentials to Kim Yong Nam
   Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Jose Manuel Inclan Embade, new Ambassador E.P. of the Republic of Cuba to Korea, presented credentials to Kim Yong Nam President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.   Kim Yong Nam had a conversation with him after receiving credentials.

articles.title: Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun meets Swiss ambassador
articles.content:
Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun meets Swiss ambassador
   Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Paek Nam Sun today met and had a talk with new Swiss Ambassador E.P. to Korea Dominique Dreyer, who paid a courtesy call on him.
